contentrichtext.text: '''Kevin Kerr''' (born 1968 [[Vancouver]]) is a [[Canadian]] playwright, actor, director and founding member of Electric Company Theatre.<ref>http://www.electriccompanytheatre.com/company/electricians/36.html</ref> From 2007 to 2010, he was Lee Playwright in Residence at [[University of Alberta]].<ref>http://leeplaywright.blogspot.com/</ref> He was born in Vancouver and grew up in [[Kamloops, British Columbia]]. He studied theatre at the [[University of British Columbia]], and at Studio 58, [[Langara College]].<ref>http://www.canadiantheatre.com/dict.pl?term=Kevin%20Kerr</ref> He has co-authored several plays with Electric Company Theatre based in [[Vancouver]], [[British Columbia]] including ''The Wake'', ''The Score'', ''Dora Flor'' and ''Her Two Husbands'', ''Flop'', ''The Fall'', and ''Brilliant! The Blinding Enlightenment of Nikola Tesla''. His play ''Unity (1918)'' explores the [[Influenza epidemic of 1918]] and won the 2002 [[Governor General's Award]] for Drama.<ref>http://www.canadiantheatre.com/dict.pl?term=Kevin%20Kerr</ref> ==Published works== *''Unity (1918)''. Vancouver, BC: Talonbooks, 2008. ISBN 978-0-88922-592-3. *''Skydive''. Vancouver, BC: Talonbooks, 2010.
